intro: Meeboldia microloba, commonly known as the small-lobed meeboldia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, intricately lobed leaves and delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth, where it thrives in the dappled light. Its botanical features include a short, fibrous root system and a branching stem covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
